answers.answer: You need to get the FBA biopsy.  Your blood levels mean nothing. Nodules are usually not cancerous, 5-15%...A nodule with calcification has a higher possibility of cancer, more like 20%, one in five.  Your nodules are large, any over 1 cm are considered large enough for biopsy.  My blood levels were normal except my THOab, I still had cancer.  I had four nodules, largest was 2.1 cm and solid, one was mixed, that was where the biggest cancer tumor was found.  Is there a family history of thyroid disease?  In my family, my dad, two brothers and I had Hashimoto's, my sister has the same cancer as I (papillary) and another sister is being tested for her nodules.

There is no family history of thyroid nodules or thyroid disease in my family.  I'm 45 years old and I was diagnosed with diabetes when I was 21 years old.  Nobody in my family has diabetes either really--other than my great-grandfather who was a "borderline diabetic when he was in his seventies.

question: PRIMARY PHYSICIAN DIDN'T REALLY EXPLAIN MY ULTRASOUND REPORT TO ME AND JUST RECOMMENDED THAT I SEE A SPECIALIST.  CAN YOU PLEASE HELP ME UNDERSTAND MY REPORT?  I AM SEEING AN ENDO NEXT WEEK.THE ULTRASOUND REPORT STATES:THE RIGHT LOBE MEASURED 4.6 X 2.1 X 2.1 CM.  THERE WAS AN UPPER POLE NODULE WHICH MEASURED 3 MM IN DIAMETER.  THERE WAS A LARGER NODULE IN THE RIGHT LOBE OF THE THYROID WHICH MEASURED 2.7 CM IN DIAMETER.  IT WAS ALMOST ISOECHOIC TO THE NORMAL THRYOID GLAND.  THE LEFT LOBE MEASURED 4.3 X 2.0 X 1.7 CM.  THERE WAS A NODULE IN THE UPPER POLE MEASURING 8MM THAT HAD A CALCIFICATION WITHIN IT.  THERE WAS A LOWER POLE NODULE MEASURING 3 MM.  IT WAS OF SOMEWHAT MIXED ECHOGENICITY.IMPRESSION:  1.  BILATERAL THYROID NODULES.  2.   CONSIDER FINE NEEDLE ASPIRATION OF A LARGE NODULE IN THE RIGHT LOBE.BY THE WAY--ALL MY THYROID BLOOD LEVELS WERE NORMAL.
title: NEED HELP FOR UNDERSTANDING ULTRASOUND REPORT
